content.webTitle: Championship roundup: Michael Appleton off to losing start at Blackburn

fields.headline: Championship roundup: Michael Appleton off to losing start at Blackburn
fields.bodyText: Blackburn 1-2 Charlton Blackburn's new manager Michael Appleton said his players need to toughen up after watching them lose again at a tense Ewood Park. "The atmosphere was a strange one so I think they've got to deal with that. I'm sure the supporters just want to see a committed performance and I'm not sure how committed they were once we conceded the second goal. There's no time to shirk your responsibilities. We're professional people: you've got to take the responsibility that goes with it." Chris Powell was delighted with his Charlton side's display. "I think we've been very positive away from home this season. We were again today, and I think that showed." Millwall 0-2 Burnley Sean Dyche challenged his players to keep building on their three successive league wins after he made a winning first return to his old club as Burnley manager. "It's good fun climbing the table like this: the feelgood factor is there. I want us to win as many games as possible and who knows where that can take us? That's the challenge. We're in the hunt right now." For Millwall it was a second defeat in three at home. "We didn't do enough," said Kenny Jackett. "Burnley showed more hunger and desire and that's disappointing. We started poorly, and we didn't defend well, not with everything we've got, not for our life, which is what we do when we're playing well. And the rest Nicola Zigic saved Birmingham from defeat at home to Brighton with a last-minute equaliser in their 2-2 draw. ■ Derby and Nottingham Forest drew 1-1, Jamie Ward earning the home side a point. ■ Ipswich and Barnsley also drew 1-1, with teenager Danny Rose heading an 89th-minute equaliser for the visitors. ■ Bristol City manager Sean O'Driscoll's first game in charge ended in an away defeat at Leeds. ■ Peterborough held in-form Hull to a 1-1 draw via midfielder Grant McCann's late penalty. ■ Sheffield Wednesday's home game with Wolves ended goalless – Dean Saunders's side failing to record a single shot on target. ■ And Watford thrashed Huddersfield 4-0, with Matej Vydra scoring twice.
